entry.title: Cultivating a collective growth mindset in Armenia

media:group.media:title: Cultivating a collective growth mindset in Armenia
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of the CivilNet Podcast, host Patrick Elliott is in conversation with Chris Dedeyan, a renowned peak performance coach and professional speaker. Together, they explore the critical mindset shifts necessary for Armenia's prosperity, delving into how collective thinking patterns can shape a nation's future. Dedeyan shares powerful insights on transforming limiting beliefs, cultivating a growth mindset, and harnessing the untapped potential within Armenian society.

entry.title: In Armeniaโs Berkaber village, border delimitation with Azerbaijan sparks hopes for peace

media:group.media:title: In Armeniaโs Berkaber village, border delimitation with Azerbaijan sparks hopes for peace
media:group.media:description:
The village of Berkaber lies on one side of the Joghaz reservoir, an artificial lake that forms part of the border between Armeniaโs northeastern Tavush region and Azerbaijanโs northwestern Gazakh district. As part of a landmark border delimitation agreement reached in April, Armenian and Azerbaijani forces withdrew from some of their positions near the village in July. CivilNet traveled to Berkaber to find out what this all means for residents.

media:group.media:title: Lenin and Stalinโs Soviet Union
media:group.media:description:
Historians Sheila Fitzpatrick, Ronald Grigor Suny, and Georgi Derluguian deliver a lecture on โClass and Nationality in Lenin and Stalinโs Soviet Union, and Post-Soviet Reverberationsโ at a symposium organized by the Monterey Initiative in Russian Studies at the Middlebury Institute of International Studies at Monterey. The lecture took place on July 5 in Yerevan.
Sheila Fitzpatrick is an Australian historian renowned for her expertise on Soviet and modern Russian history, particularly during Joseph Stalinโs rule.
Ronald Grigor Suny is a distinguished professor of history at the University of Michigan and emeritus professor of political science and history at the University of Chicago.
Georgi Derluguian is a sociologist and historian known for his interdisciplinary work on social change, revolutions, and global history. He currently teaches at New York University Abu Dhabi. This yearโs Monterey Summer Symposium on Russia took place in Yerevan, Tbilisi, and Istanbul from July 1 to July 20.

media:group.media:title: ิฟีซึีกีถึโค ีถีธึ ีคีบึีธึีจ ีขีกึีพีฅึ, ีฎีกีผีฅึีจ ีคีฅีผ ีนีฏีกีถ
media:group.media:description:
ีีกีพีธึีทีซ ิฟีซึีกีถึ ีฃีตีธึีฒีซ ีคีบึีธึีกีฏีกีถีถีฅึีซ ีฐีกีดีกึ ีถีธึ ีธึีฝีธึีดีถีกีฏีกีถ ีฟีกึีซีถ ีถีธึีกีฏีกีผีธึีตึ ีคีบึีธึีธึีด ีฝีฏีฝีพีฅึ: ิฑีตีฝ ีฟีกึีซ ีคีบีธึีถ ีจีถีคีธึีถีฅึ 34 ีกีทีกีฏีฅึีฟีซึ ิตึีฏีธึ ีฟีกึีซ ีกีผีกีป ีง ีฝีฏีฝีพีฅีฌ ีคีบึีธึีซ ีทีซีถีกึีกึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจ, ีถีกีญีธึีค ีคีบึีธึีจ ีพีฉีกึีกีตีซีถ ีงึึ ีีกีฐีดีกีถีกีฆีกีฟีดีกีถ ีกึีคีตีธึีถึีธึีด ีคีบึีธึีจ ีฝีกีฐีดีกีถีซีถ ีกีดีฅีถีกีดีธีฟ ีฃีฟีถีพีธีฒ ีทีซีถีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีซึ ีง ีคีกึีฑีฅีฌ. ีคีบึีธึีซึ ีดีซ ึีกีถีซ ีดีฅีฟึ ีกีตีถ ีฏีธีฒีด ีฝีกีฐีดีกีถีกีตีซีถ ีบีกีฟีถีฅีทีถีฅึีถ ีฅีถ, ีดีซ ึีกีถีซ ีฐีกึีตีธึึ ีดีฅีฟึ ีกีตีถ ีฏีธีฒีดี ีกีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีกีฏีกีถ ีคึีธีทีจึ

media:group.media:title: ีีตีธึีถีซึีซ ีณีกีถีกีบีกึีฐีซีถี ีดีกีฝีถีกีพีธึ ีจีถีฏีฅึีธึีฉีตีธีึีถโค ีีกีทีซีถีตีกีถีซ ีกีฏีถีกึีฏีจ
media:group.media:description:
ยซิฑึึีกีญีตีกีถ ีคีซีฟีกีถีฏีตีกีถยป ีฐีฅึีฉีกีฏีกีถ ีฉีธีฒีกึีฏีดีกีถีจ ีีฟีฅีฌีฌีก ีีฅีฐึีกีขีฅีฏีตีกีถีถ ีธึ ีีซีฃึีกีถ ิณึีซีฃีธึีตีกีถีจ ึีถีถีกึีฏีธึีด ีฅีถ ีีซีฏีธีฌ ีีกีทีซีถีตีกีถีซ ีดีซ ีทีกึึ ีฐีกีตีฟีกึีกึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึ, ีธึีธีถึ ีกึีพีฅีฌ ีฅีถ ีฝีฅีบีฟีฅีดีขีฅึีซ 1-ีซีถ ีฏีกีตีกึีกีฎ ีดีกีดีธึีฌีซ ีกีฝีธึีฌีซีฝีซ ีจีถีฉีกึึีธึีดึ ินีธีฒีกึีฏีดีกีถ ีจีถีฉีกึึีธึีด ีกีถีคึีกีคีกึีฑ ีง ีฏีกีฟีกึีพีธึีด ิฑีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีซ ีกึีฟีฃีธึีฎีถีกีญีกึีกึ ีีฅีตีฐีธึีถ ิฒีกีตึีกีดีธีพีซ ึ ีถีกีญีกีฃีกีฐีซ ึ ีฃีถีกีฏีกีถ ีีซึีดีฅีฉ ีีกีปีซึีซ ีฐีกีตีฟีกึีกึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีซีถึ ินีฅีดีกีถีฅึีซึ ีดีฅีฏีจ ีพีฅึีกีขีฅึีธึีด ีง ิฑีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีธึีด ีกีถึีกีฎ ีกึีฟีกีฐีฅึีฉ ีญีธึีฐึีคีกึีกีถีกีฏีกีถ ีจีถีฟึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีซีถ, ีธึีธีถึ ีดีกีถึีกีดีกีฝีถ ีกีถีคึีกีคีกึีฑีฅีฌ ีง ีพีฅึีฌีธึีฎีกีขีกีถ ิทีคีธึีกึีค ิฑีผีกึีฅีฌีตีกีถีถ ีซึ ีฝีตีธึีถีกีฏีธึีดึ
ิทีคีธึีกึีค ิฑีผีกึีฅีฌีตีกีถีซ ีพีฅึีฌีธึีฎีกีฏีกีถ ีกีทีญีกีฟีกีถึีซีถ ีฐีถีกึีกีพีธึ ีง ีกีปีกีฏึีฅีฌี ีดีซีกีถีกีฌีธีพ ีคึีกีดีกีฐีกีพีกึีซีถึ
